01.synopsis: Duergar looking at stonework. Gruff sounding but surprisingly sophisticated. He asks you to examine the stonework and responds with his interpretation based on what you tell him

02.synopsis: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

01_1.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_1.text: How peculiar. Smooth face, cobbled edges. They're a sign - they must be.
01_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason Kith facing away from player, looking at rubble.

01_14.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_14.text: A sundweller in these parts? Look here, my top-side friend - I need fresh eyes. And I doubt I'll find fresher.
01_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The stonemason turns to you and addresses you directly.

01_51.speaker: Player
01_51.text: Fine. What should I be looking at?

01_3.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_3.text: The rock. The rubble. All of it, if I may be so bold.

01_31.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_31.text: Take a look. Tell me what you see. And be thorough.

01_72.speaker: Player
01_72.text: Assess the statue for technique and composition.

01_90.speaker: Narrator
01_90.text: *The statue's meandering curves and golden edges stand out against the weathered masonry behind it.*

01_20.speaker: Narrator
01_20.text: *Two styles, two eras. The statue was carved from newer stone and erected by late-comers to this ancient fortress.*

01_54.speaker: Narrator
01_54.text: *You consider the differences, but they mean nothing to you.*

01_46.speaker: Player
01_46.context: InternalNodeContext: this skillcheck only if the player has neither REALLY_DWARF or REALLY_DEEPGNOME

01_65.speaker: Narrator
01_65.text: *Boulders and stone bricks of various sizes clutter the corridor, many split cleanly in two. Yet some walls remain fully intact.*

01_77.speaker: Narrator
01_77.text: *No quake brought these rocks down - they were smashed through in an instant. Something big charged through here. Something very big.*

01_81.speaker: Narrator
01_81.text: *What this pattern signifies, you can't fathom.*

01_12.speaker: Player
01_12.text: Survey the area for unseen curiosities.

01_89.speaker: Narrator
01_89.text: *Several glassy stones stand out in the debris. Their borders are coated with tiny yellow crystals.*

01_55.speaker: Narrator
01_55.text: *The hottest of flames smoothed the stone and left sulphuric crystals behind. The fires of the Hells have touched Grymforge.*

01_53.speaker: Player
01_53.text: Try to remember the tome 'Fables of Forges Grym'.

01_7.speaker: Narrator
01_7.text: *You recall the tale of a Sharran fortress armed with impenetrable adamantine - a metal created by a gnomish mage.*

01_56.speaker: Narrator
01_56.text: *There was also whispers of the gnome's secret project - an invincible guardian - though its existence was never proven.*

01_22.speaker: Narrator
01_22.text: *The book's style was not particularly gripping, and as such, its contents are tough to remember.*

01_24.speaker: Player
01_24.text: I know everything about this place. In fact, it was hand-forged by a flumph called Grym...

01_16.speaker: Narrator
01_16.text: *The duergar listens to your tall tale. Though sceptical of the more suspect details, they seem amused enough by the story.*
01_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar watches the player tell a tall tale, amused.

01_39.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_39.text: Fascinating... What begat such a powerful flumph? Does it still live here to this day?

01_58.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_58.text: How exactly does a flumph hand-forge anything?

01_93.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_93.text: I prefer evidence, hard as stone. Look again, what can you see before you?

01_9.speaker: Player
01_9.text: You don't talk like the rest of your crew. Fancy britches, are you?

01_6.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_6.text: There is nothing fancy about good work. Respect the stone, or it may crush you.

01_92.speaker: Player
01_92.text: Recite the tale you remembered from your reading.

01_15.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_15.text: How fascinating. I told my kinfolk that book-learning has its benefits.

01_19.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_19.text: A crafty gnome helping forge a fortress that would last an aeon.  Mythic metal atop stone hewn by the devoted.

01_21.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_21.text: That's to say nothing of this tale of an invulnerable protector - it's unfortunate the Sharran's successors found no proof.

01_82.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_82.text: Doesn't explain this infernal plate I found, though. Here, take it, perhaps you'll be able to figure it out why it's here.

01_79.speaker: Player
01_79.text: I am ready to report my observations.

01_84.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_84.text: Incredible - an entire history, risen from dirt and debris! Picture it:

01_64.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_64.text: An ancient city, hewn from the stone by disciples of Shar, later abandoned.

01_26.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_26.text: Untold centuries later, a new tribe revives it. Fresh walls, fresh sculptures...

01_17.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_17.text: ... until a great hellbeast charges through, toppling the walls and crushing the people!

01_87.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_87.text: Heh - that explains the infernal plate I found. Perhaps you might have use of it.

01_70.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_70.text: But my work has only begun. There is more still to find. I must get to it!

01_62.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_62.text: Yes, the rubble - it was a great beast that tore these walls down. I should have known.

01_85.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_85.text: The statue is newer than the fortress, you say? So obvious in hindsight.

01_94.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_94.text: Sulphur. Of course! The rocks have been altered by hellfire.

01_59.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_59.text: Alas, you've left me with more questions than answers. My survey continues.

01_29.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_29.text: Peering into cracks and crevasses in hope to find history's morsels.

01_37.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_37.text: I have come up regrettably short. I hope you might see truths where I cannot.

01_96.speaker: Player
01_96.text: A friendly welcome? A rarity in the Underdark.

01_40.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_40.text: Ease your suspicions - I've got no mind for slaving. My passion is stone, and my god is the chisel.

01_45.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_45.text: But these learned eyes reach their limits. And so I must humbly request yours.
01_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason gestures to his own eyes.

01_78.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_78.text: As rare as a smile in Sschindylryn, you might say. But I've no skill for slaving - I prefer chisel to cane.

01_8.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_8.text: The past is nearer than we think. We simply must dig.

01_28.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_28.text: Please - a quick look, if you don't mind.

01_49.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01_49.text: The True Soul, the battle - too many distractions. There is still truth to uncover.

02_0.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_0.text: Whatever that look is - don't give it to me.

02_2.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_2.text: I'll give you one thing - you got a keen eye. Even jarghs have their uses.

02_3.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_3.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02_4.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_4.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

02_5.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_5.text: You offed Nere, and I'm still waitin' for pay. Drugnin' waste.

02_6.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_6.text: Get lost. I'm here to survey, and I haven't got ears for a third opinion.

02_7.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02_7.text: What you want from me? I'm not impressed.
